オプション1: Star Man arrived at the VirtualBecks Port ruins at night.

(Should I wait until morning to meet Nes…?
 We still don’t know for sure they did anything.)
(But…)

(If I weigh ‘being rude by calling at midnight and embarrassing myself’
 against ‘Square Man’s safety’… the answer is obvious.)
Star Man scanned the area.

(I don’t know where Nes is.
 I’ll look for Nes while also searching for clues about Square Man.)

There were a few houses and warehouses.
Star Man checked each and every one.
But he found neither Nes nor Square Man.
(Where did they go…? I’ll search again come morning.)
Star Man slept in the shadows at VirtualBecks.
The next morning, Star Man searched VirtualBecks again.
<Knock>
<Rustle, rustle>

(A small sound from that house.
 Is Nes hiding in there?
 It could be a monster. If I greet them normally, will they come out?)
(…No, that definitely won’t happen.)
Star Man readied his stone axe and walked around the hut.
(A sticky, squelching sound is coming from inside.)
"Is someone there?"
Star Man called out. The squelching stopped.
(The sound stopped. There’s a person.)
Star Man came to the hut’s entrance.
"Is someone there? Answer me."
(No response…)
Star Man went into the hut.
"Ugh… gugh."
The inside of the hut reeked. The floor was buried in trash.

The garbage was dust-free, as if dumped recently.
Star Man walked over the trash.
Searching the hut, he found a person sitting and frozen in place.
It was Nes.
At Nes’s feet were bananas and banana peels.
"Hey…"
Star Man said.
"…Ah… yes…"
Nes felt different from last time.
"Sorry for barging in. I have something to ask."
"Ah, yes. What is it?"
(He understands me…?)
"A child named Square Man is missing. I’m looking for him."
"O-okay."
"You don’t know anything?"
"No, I’m not really sure…"
"Anything at all. If you know, please tell me."
"I just live here, foraging."
"I see. For the record, let me check the other huts inside as well."
"Uh… I’d rather you didn’t do that…"
"Is there some problem with that?"
"No, not exactly… It’s fine. Go ahead and look."
Star Man stepped out of the hut.

He checked the other buildings, but they were dust-choked ruins
with no signs of human presence.
"…Sorry to trouble you."
Star Man let Nes know, left VirtualBecks, and returned to base.
